Comment: Harris wouldn't automatically become the Democratic frontrunner if Biden dropped out--technically, as the party nomination hasn't been finalized yet, the Democrats could pick anyone at the convention.   But logistically, there are a lot of reasons why it would almost certainly be Harris who replaced Biden. One of them is money--Harris is a part of the current ticket, so she can directly inherit all the money the campaign has currently raised. If someone other than Harris becomes the candidate, campaign finance laws prevent them from inheriting most of it. They would have to start fundraising from scratch, and you don't want to be doing that in July.  Harris could have anyone as a running mate; it doesn't need to be the Speaker.
